The P2P lending is an innovative scheme for achieving this objective.  üî∫Parties to the P2P Lendingüî∫  ‚úîÔ∏èLENDER: A lender is a trader who has in his wallet,  funds he considers surplus to his immediate trading requirements and wants to earn on it rather than leave it idle. ‚úîÔ∏èBORROWER: Borrowers are traders seeking to trade with equity greater than what they currently have in their wallets. ‚úîÔ∏èPOOL MANAGER : Algorithm developed to manage and coordinate the P2P lending process by managing the liquidity pool.  üî∫The Processüî∫ ‚úîÔ∏è Willing lender transfers funds (BTC) to the liquidity pool and specifies how many days he wishes to lend for (7,14 or 30 days) with an option to rollover ‚úîÔ∏è Prospective borrower sends request to pool to request for funds and specifies number of days. ‚úîÔ∏èPool manager matches borrowers request with lenders offer on a first come, first served basis and executes transfer of funds between parties  üî∫Interest rateüî∫ Lending rates are varied on a daily basis, calculated by pool manager algorithm which uses market conditions to determine the rates. Contracts are activated based on prevailing rates at time of match.  ‚úÖPool manager manages the lend contract by tracking all trades excuted with lent funds. If borrower‚Äôs trading losses erodes his own equity, pool manager closes all open trades to prevent loss of borrowed equity and gives borrower  time to re-fund his own equity contribution to resume trading. If borrower fails to fund, borrowed funds are returned to lender at the expiration of tenor.  ‚úÖLender earns interest regardless of trading outcome.
